column2: The Surveyor I is an entry or junior-level position for new graduates and/or those candidates with less than five (5) years of experience in an applicable industry. The Surveyor I, under a direct supervisor, performs work involving conventional surveying practices. The primary function is to develop the ability to effectively examine and report on vessels and other marine structures during and after construction relative to compliance with the applicable requirements for maintaining the vessel in Classification with ABS and meeting associated statutory and special service requirements related to Safety of Life at Sea, Loadline, Tonnage, Cargo Gear and Pollution Prevention Certification.    What You Will Do (with the assistance and guidance of an experienced ABS Surveyor):     Acts as a professional specialist for the organization in the application of related rules, regulations, requirements, concepts, principles, and processes.     Performs routine surveys on classed vessels, platforms, or other marine structures and at manufacturers for classification and compliance with statutory requirements.     Prepares technically accurate and timely reports of inspections and surveys performed.     Engages in contact with clients to resolve problems within areas of expertise.     Maintains survey files in an orderly and up-to-date manner in the area of responsibility.     Develops the skills necessary for the administration of office procedures and monitoring of business performance at an assigned port.     Through broader and more technically challenging work assignments, the individual must develop a thorough understanding of field operations, policies, methods, and procedures.   Skills    Qualifications from a tertiary institution within a relevant field of engineering or physical science (minimum two (2) years program); or     Qualifications from a marine or nautical institution and relevant seagoing experience as a certificated ship officer, and     Proficiency in the English language commensurate with the scope of statutory certification and services and, before assignment, with their future work.     Appropriate certification and/or licenses in areas of specialization may be required.      Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities     Ability to develop a working knowledge of ABS Rules, Guides, statutory regulations, and related instructions, as well as the ABS Employee Safety Policy.     Ability to read engineering plans and have a basic understanding of shipbuilding practices and vessel operations.     Ability to perform surveys in the prescribed format.     Knowledge of computer programs or software packages related to job responsibilities.     Knowledge of related technical interfaces required for group project work.     Knowledge of ships engineering systems and machinery.     Ability to communicate, orally and in writing, pertinent information relative to assigned area of technical expertise.     Ability to analyze problems and propose solutions.     Responsiveness to customers and the ability to work well with others.     Ability to become familiar with the ABS Health, Safety, Quality, and Environmental Management Systems.
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Environment management, Field operations, Construction, Incharge, Marine structures, Management systems, Surveyor, Machinery, Monitoring, Offshore platforms

column2: Reviews the contractual agreements and the vessels manning plan, performing and monitoring all selection steps, i.e. identification, evaluation and selection of crew, for the effective recruitment of the most suitable and qualified candidates, according to ship flag legislation, technical requirements and available budget.     Reviews and approves the employment contracts of all assigned vessels seafarers issued by the CSCs, to ensure they are according to company s procedures and agreed terms and local/flag legislation.     Proposes and implements the relief/rotation planning and EoC procedures of the ships personnel, focusing on the provision of alternatives for the continuous and effective operation of the vessels.     Timely identifies future and current vacancies in vessels personnel and informs accordingly his/her supervisor, the CSCs, in order to support the accurate and fast coverage of needs. Supports the FP Manager to develop the annual manning plan and budget.     Prepares and implements Crew planning (timeliness reliefs, accuracy of documentation, budget compliance, response to customer requests).     Coordinates with the FP Manager and CSCs regarding the prompt and accurate implementation of changes in ports procedures, such as visas, permissions, etc., concerning the smooth embarkation and disembarkation of crewmembers if management intervention required.     Implements the relief/rotation planning and lay-off procedures according to the contractual agreements and vessels needs for each seafarer, focusing on the provision of alternatives for the continuous and effective operation of the vessels. Liaises with vessels, CSCs/manning agencies, port agents travel agents in order to ensure that crew embarkations/ disembarkations on vessels are carried out in the most efficient and cost effective way.     Communicates with flag state authorities in order to gather information related to the specific regulations each flag state may require. Maintains and regularly updates all required documentation, so as to safeguard the legitimate operation of vessels and employment of seafarers.     Informs the personnel in the assigned vessels of potential changes in the operational procedures, and makes available all the respective documentation to all crew members.     Implements the relief/rotation planning and lay-off procedures according to the contractual agreements and vessels needs, for each seafarer focusing on achieving necessary re-joining rate and the provision of alternatives for the continuous and effective operation of the vessels.     Monitors and evaluates the performance of the assigned vessels seafarers and identifies their training needs, develops and proposes the training plan and cooperates with the company s training centres so as to provide the required training for the improvement of technical skills and competencies of officers and ratings. Follows-up the successful completion of all training courses, in order to enhance the efficiency of the crewmembers for the safe and effective operation of all vessels.     Support the development, submission and implementation of the department s budget, reviews its accurate execution, identifies cost saving opportunities and proposes corrective actions in case of deviations, in order to ensure compliance with set targets.     Support, monitors, follow up, implementation of software, safety management system, employment laws and regulations as assigned and informs FP Manager as needed.     Co-ordinate with CSC / GSC and make sure all manning activities outsourced to CSC / GSC are timely and accurately performed.     Develops effective batching of seafarers allocation to assigned vessels, in order to generate cost effective travelling to all vessel, as well as timely coverage of operational needs. Reviews crew travelling costs to the assigned vessels, and contributes in relative market research, in order to identify the best value-for-money services.     Monitors the accurate execution of crew budget, identifies cost saving opportunities and proposes corrective actions in case of deviations, in order to ensure compliance with set targets.   Skills    Bachelor degree or Certificate in Maritime relevant field    Work Experience    5 years of experience as FPO in maritime recruiting    Job-Specific Skills:    Very good knowledge of the vessels crew requirements and seafarers specifications     Knowledge of the local market dynamics both for demand-supply situation     Exposure in the development of employment contracts     Experience in recruitment, training and development methodologies     Good knowledge of the seafarers rights and the maritime labour law     Knowledge of the maritime legal framework e.g. employers obligations, recruitment prerequisites etc.     Fluency in English     PC literacy

column2: TECHNICAL SUPERINTENDENT      Your Key Responsibilities      Ensure that company policy related to Health, Safety, Security, Environment and Quality Assurance (HSEQA) issues are effectively implemented and regularly monitored for its compliance in relation to operation of the fleet vessels. To advise Corporate Compliance Manager (CCM) and Designated Person Ashore (DPA) in writing any information related to the vessel or crew s inability to comply with ESM s environmental measures and any other marine environmental protection requirements.      Maintain contact with Classification societies, shipyards, repair firms, industry groups, trade associations, equipment manufacturers and designers, Government bodies and other organizations that may be helpful to carry out the assigned duties and responsibilities.      To project realistic annual operating budget for his vessel by taking view of Statutory, Flag and Port Requirements with appropriate reasoning to the owners & obtain timely approval.      To comply with budgetary allocation for his vessel by regular monitoring and taking suitable actions to avoid negative variance.      To monitor inventory control of stores and spares, performance of vessels, compliance with all applicable health, safety, security and pollution prevention regulations, certification status of vessels and ensure that at all times vessels are maintained in seaworthy condition and trading certificates are valid.      To carry out routine vessel inspections, dry-docking and major repairs in coordination with principals after making the cost comparison of various yards and repairers in the most efficient manner.      To ensure that all technical reports as required by various principals are timely dispatched.      To monitor and timely correct all deficiencies/defects that exists in the vessels and ensure immediate corrective action are taken for any major defect in order that the vessels performance and safety is not jeopardized.      To maintain the vessel preparedness at all times to comply with Port State Control and Oil Majors by close monitoring and review of Vessel s conditions in line with VIQ requirements.      Oversee that all items pertaining to health, safety, security and pollution prevention are regularly checked with the aim of achieving high standards of safe and pollution free voyages and general well-being of all on board the vessels.      To monitor and ensure resource allocation by regular review of Work and Rest Hours of personnel on board and take suitable steps to conform compliance with Company s Work and Rest Hours Policy.      To verify all incoming reports from the vessels and identify areas which require immediate attention and take corrective actions      Closely monitor performance of all vessels and ensure that all Charter Party requirements are being fulfilled. Identify reasons for deviation if any and take remedial measures.      To prepare all necessary documentation pertaining to Hull and Machinery and P & I insurance claims for vessels under their charge and forward same to the Principals and/or the Insurance division for processing of claims.      To carry out periodical inspection of vessels and subsequently prepare a detailed report and formulate and up-gradation plan and follow-up with the vessels.      To prepare repair specifications and coordinate with various repair firms for effecting major repairs and Dry Docking,      To monitor survey status and certification status of vessels and ensure surveys/inspections are arranged in time to maintain validity of all certificates.      In order to discharge the above listed responsibilities, the Superintendent is required to use PHOENIX, Company s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System designed for such purposes and keep all vessel s records updated on the system.      We are looking for      Individuals who are highly motivated and experienced in managing Tanker vessels as Technical Superintendent      Individuals with prior sailing experience onboard tanker vessels as Chief Engineer will be an advantage      Individuals with sound Technical knowledge and expertise      Individuals with good administrative, planning and implementation skills      Individuals with ability to demonstrate good time management, leadership and organisational skills      Individuals must be fluent in English and possess good English writing skills      Computer literacy is a must
column11: Any Graduate, Post Graduation Not Required
column13: Technical Superintendent, Administration, ERP, Manager Quality Assurance, Compliance, Resource allocation, Inventory control, Machinery, Technical Executive, Monitoring

column2: Manager is responsible for growing revenue from the customer base of South Asia both for within   the India and Globally.   The role will be responsible for supporting the Cluster Commercial Manager - MESAA in growing   the Top Line, maintaining Customer Relations and preparing Tender and Bid Documentation.   They are generalists with a depth of knowledge on their geography and externally will strongly   position Inchcape as the partner of choice both in their territory and globally.       Duties and Responsibilities:   Business Planning   To deliver against a business plan for India with a strong focus on growing existing business   and development of new business opportunities.   To fully engage and work with the Marine Operations Team in delivering the revenue for the   allocated areas   Thorough and structured pipeline formation supporting the business plan covering lead   generation, qualification and proposal stages to obtain commitment and then sale.   To develop and maintain customer relationships at all levels of the customers organization.   Management of selected existing and potential accounts with the focus to develop growth with   these accounts.   Support South Asia team to ensure growth of accounts owned by South Asia team.   Proactively developing new business for the South Asia region globally   Build and maintain relationships with existing accounts focusing on long-term development and   revenue growth.   Work with Cluster Commercial Manager - MESAA AGM in various countries to ensure all   customer queries/complaints are handled professionally.   Maximize customer value creation and profitability for our clients current and new customer   base.   Work alongside bid centre to assist in preparing tender and big contract responses.     Support in the preparation of proposals/presentations.   Fact Finding/pre-qualification for potential commercial targets, liaising with line manager.   Provide market and competitor intelligence.   Undertake analysis arising from large data with a view to optimizing commercial efforts.   Revenue Growth from the accounts you will manage.   Reporting   Direct reporting to Cluster Commercial Manager, MESAA   Quarterly business plan review with VP, Commercial.   Any specific project reporting   Account Management   Single point of contact for key accounts.   Regular and structure account calls/meetings with a documented meeting purpose, plan and   desired pay-off.   Account activity, information and opportunities captured in Customer Relationship Management   systems (Sales Force).   Ensure Account Receivables less that 90 days for all owned accounts within South Asia   Follow-up on Accounts Receivable for owned customers   Sale Execution   Securing customer commitment and agreement.   Pricing and rates qualification and agreement with VP Commercial approval.   Contract formation and tender processing with expertise from contracts team and guidance   from VP, Commercial.   Review and follow up after sale is closed.   Lead growth of Inchcape Products and Solutions within South Asia.   Market Presence and Profile   Establish self and Inchcape as the recognized partner for Port Agency and Marine Services by   growing knowledge base, networking with credible sources and partners, researching market   trends and actively participating at industry events.   Share industry knowledge and experiences within the Commercial Team and wider business to enhance Inchcape s value proposition.       Knowledge Skills Experience   Extensive in port agency in South Asia   Port Agency and Marine Services global.   Sales Business Planning short to long term.   Pipeline creation and execution.   Contract formation and negotiation.   Customer engagement and management.   Working in complex international organizations.   Team management and development.   Tender and Bid Writing       Qualifications:   Relevant academic qualification - required   MBA or higher learning within Shipping Industry - desirable   Multiple languages - desirable

column2: Company BriefPlanys is a deep tech start-up revolutionizing infrastructure integrity and risk assessment. Planys specializes in smart underwater inspection solutions and sophisticated digital analytics and reporting of NDT data. Planys envisions to steer a new course in the maintenance and inspection industry with its disruptive innovations in the field of marine robotics, novel underwater NDT methods and AI enabled post-inspection analytical digital reporting dashboard. Planys helps asset owners/operators in taking data-driven decisions for effective maintenance and repair of their critical assets. (Website: www.planystech.com)Job Brief :Software team in Planys Technologies deals with various departments like, Business development team,operations team, Product development team and Maintenance team where the software development team isfocused on delivering software requirements of each department like web-based business intelligence reportingplatform, data analytical tools, embedded software for ROVs, Vision systems (Streaming, Storing, Videoprocessing and Image processing) for video analytics, online tools/service applications, software applicationsand Artificial Intelligence/Machine learning related products.As a Software Lead in Planys you need to understand the requirements of each team, analyse the requirementsand lead the software development team towards achieving their targets. You need to have an ability to foreseethe importance of emerging technologies of software industry and integrate the necessary innovations into theexisting products of Planys Technologies.Roles and Responsibilities You will be working on Software Architecture designing, developing, integrating and testing along withleading a group of talented software individuals Your primary role will be management, leadership, inter departmental cooperation, communication,high-level design, project/product management, supervision of development activities, training ofmembers, strategizing, plan build-up, plan execution monitoring, code reviews,documentation reviews, task monitoring, task scheduling, motivating the team, process build-up,stakeholder management, technology identification, feasibility studies, R&D, product specificationdevelopment, management and maintenance of existing products, process execution supervision,product test standard specification, oversee product testing, bug and feature management, ITmanagement, management of repositories and associated development tools/platforms, IPRmanagement, ISO compliance management, budget management, timeline monitoring, bug/featuretracking, and other relevant leadership and managerial activities. Hands-on development activities willform a small fraction of your role There are two major teams at Planys  Core Development Team (C/C++) and Web Development Team(NodeJS). You will be required to lead both the teams with your judgement, technical contribution andexperience. However, it is not required that you are an expert in both. Master of one and experiencewith the other is the preferred requirement Role with the Core Development Team: Developing a software system based on Linux kernel environment which is compatible andcustomizable with various sensors communicate over serial, ethernet, etc., Planys Technologies Pvt. LtdSubmersible Inspection and Survey Solutions Developing a software application to interface modules like video streaming, micro controllerunits, autonomous vehicle control systems with a web-based UI for pilots to visualize andcontrol the ROV navigation. Developing an analytical tool to understand the data collected by various onboard sensors ofROV and developing a predictive maintenance tool with growing data collected from the ROV?? Developing a robust real time vision system to stream and store in different client platforms likebrowser, desktop applications etc. Develop AI related applications involving computer vision, Development of software to interface with specific firmware Role with the Web Development Team: Lead and guide an enthusiastic group of full-stack web developers and contribute in thedevelopment of web based platforms and future SaaS products for the organization, Developing a web-based business intelligence software system to integrate the data collectedby ROV?? and presenting the data in a sensible way with easy to explore UI experience, Developing a robust real time video streaming system to in different client platforms likebrowser, desktop applications etc. Development of internal web-based products and services for organizational work-flow towards??nspection report creation process Building a scalable software infrastructure to support remote maintenance and development Owning to the small size of the organization, as an additional responsibility you will also be required tooversee the IT Department working along with the CTOEducational Qualifications:B.Tech/M.Tech/M.Sc in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/ Electrical Engineering or any relatedfieldsExpected Skillsets Towards the Core Development Team: Linux and Linux-kernel based software development Proficient in object-oriented concepts of C++ and advanced concepts C. Alternatively extensivedevelopment in python can be considered Conceptual knowledge of networking and its implementation on Linux platform Experience in image enhancement tools like open-cv, PIL, scikit-image is recommended. column2: ?    You will have the day-to-day responsibility for the TORM environment running in an Azure cloud.   TORM operates with a Microsoft-based environment and uses Windows server as well as Microsoft SQL server. Microsoft's BI stack plays a significant role in the day-to-day decision support of TORM's business units, and BizTalk is responsible for the integration between the business systems. We use Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework for our cloud adoption.   You will be responsible for providing ownership and leadership in Azure architecture, cloud deployment, administration, managing Azure solutions as well as the storage, identity, governance, virtual networks, security, and computing in a cloud environment all in cooperation with specialized colleagues in Group IT.    Your primary tasks:      Define high-level migration plans to address the gaps between the current and future state.    Architecting and implementing Azure Cloud cost effective solutions for non-production environment such as Disaster Recovery, Development, Testing servers.    Managing and deploying Azure solutions.   Using PowerShell to deploy resources and repeatable deployments with ARM templates.    Explore configuring hybrid connectivity between on-premises environments and Azure, and how to monitor network performance to comply with service-level agreements.    Automating Deployment and Scale of Azure IaaS Solution script, automate, and scale Azure deployments.    Install and configure Virtual Machines, Storage Account, Virtual Network Load Balancer in the Azure Cloud.   Configure Virtual Machine Scale Sets to optimize the performance of Application.   Consult on Azure native technology capabilities.   Assist with Azure Cost estimation.   Debugging and troubleshooting of issues/opening tickets with Microsoft   Manage, monitor, and report resource utilization on daily basis. Including but not limited to scaling vertical and horizontal.     Your background and experience    Professionally, you have 7-10 years of operational experience with optimizing the performance of Microsoft products (Windows Server, SQL Server, Active Directory) and clear understanding of core Cloud Computing services. You need to understand the basic functioning of Networking, Databases, Software, and Servers in the Cloud. You need to have a good understanding of security in a Microsoft environment, including Kerberos. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex IT information in simplified form depending on the target audience, and you have the drive to improve and do proactive research around emerging technologies/new iterations of MS Azure.   You have a good understanding of enterprise change management processes.   You are experienced with scripting (PowerShell) and can see how automation of operational tasks can contribute to the value-creation and operational excellence.   As a person you are structured, proactive, and good at prioritizing. You are defined by taking ownership of your assignments, can work independently while also achieving results through connecting with others. You are fluent in English both verbally and in writing.    We offer    As an employee in TORM, you will be part of a leading, world-class shipping company. Our corporate culture is characterized by well-defined values and an informal, but performance-oriented working environment.   We offer a competitive salary which will reflect your experience and qualifications, and an attractive benefits package including bonus and pension.   We are an international team, built on common values embracing innovation, diversity, mutual respect, passion to make a positive difference, accountability, commitment to excellence, and teamwork. We believe in the importance of personal and professional development.   Working at TORM can be challenging, but it is also rewarding and inspiring as we work continually on securing a safe, pleasant, and ergonomic work environment. Our ambition is for you to find a good balance between your work and your private life. Whatever your function at TORM will be, your contribution will make a difference.   ?
column11: Any Graduate, Any Postgraduate
column13: Cloud computing, Automation, Change management, Debugging, Active directory, Biztalk, Windows, microsoft, Troubleshooting, SQL

column2: EZ Logistics is seeking a skilled andexperienced Logistics Manager who works in dual role as development managerOperational Manager you will work as responsible for Development,Managing and Coordinating Logistics Operations within a specific region           BusinessDevelopment Manager          Generate leads through existing and new contactsfor business in the field of FTL LTL   by approaching new clients      Daily Sales calls visit customers       Focus on winning and maintaining a profitablebusiness.      To develop and maintain a good relationship withthe client.      Develop a system for strong payment follow-up andshould be able to take responsibility for outstanding Payments.          OperationsManager              The Operations Manager for logistics operations isresponsible for overseeing and managing the dispatches andacknowledgement-receiving processes of a company     As an individual player, theOperations Manager plays a critical role in ensuring efficient and effectivelogistics operations    This includes coordinating with various stakeholders,managing transportation activities, and maintaining strong connections withinthe transportation industry      The Operations Manager will work closely with thelogistics team and other departments to ensure smooth and timely delivery ofgoods or services     You will play a crucial role in maintaining smoothoperations while booking vehicles and fostering strong relationships on behalfof EZ Logistics with local transport partners    D   esign and implement solutions that address thedistribution and warehousing needs of our customers                     Requirements         The Operations Manager has the end-to-endresponsibility for First Mid Mile deliveries on all these aspects as perthe internal norms of the company        1.    Dispatch Management:   Strategically plan and manage logistics, warehouse, transportationand customer services and execute dispatch schedules to ensure timely deliveryof products or services. Monitor the movement of goods, track shipments,consider factors such as vehicle capacity, delivery routes, and timeliness andaddress any delays or issues. Collaborate with internal teams, suppliers, andtransporters to optimize logistics operations.        2.AcknowledgementReceiving   : Keep track of quality, quantity, stock levels,delivery times, transport costs and efficiency, Oversee the acknowledgementreceiving process to confirm successful delivery and receipt of goods orservices. Resolve any discrepancies or issues related to deliveryacknowledgements.        3. LocalTransport Network   : Arrange warehouse, catalogue goods, plan routesand process shipments, utilize your existing connections and experience in thelogistics space to establish and maintain relationships with local transportpartners, including carriers, warehouse and logistics service providersLeverage these connections to ensure reliable and cost-effective transportationservices.        4.Communication and Negotiation   : Possess excellentcommunication and negotiation skills to interact effectively with transportpartners, vendors, Warehouse ownerssuppliers, manufacturers, retailers,consumers and internal stakeholders. Collaborate closely with all teams toensure smooth coordination and timely delivery of goods   .        5.Performance Monitoring and Reporting   : Implementperformance metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure theeffectiveness and efficiency of logistics operations. Monitor and analyzelogistics data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.Generate regular reports and provide insights to management on logisticsperformance.        6.Supervise, coach and train warehouse workforce:   Collaboratewith cross-functional teams, including the Marketing team, warehouse, andcustomer service, to ensure seamless coordination and integration of logisticsactivities. Provide guidance and support to the logistics team, includingtraining, performance evaluation, and coaching.        7: Comply with laws, regulationsand ISO requirements:   Ensure compliance in hub operations andlogistics in all areas, execute plans for ensuring the availability of an adequatefleet and build the fleet and infrastructure to meet the supply   .        8:   Demonstrable ability to lead andmanage staff: Manage the onboarding and training activities for supervisors andDelivery Executives and ensure that they follow the required guidelines whileperforming different tasks.         9:   Ability to work independentlyand handle multiple projects Ensure prompt responses to queries /concernsraised by the Delivery Executives thereby clearing doubts/ apprehensions ifany.        As an Operations Manager, you will be responsible for leading andmanaging all aspects of the companys day-to-day operations, includinglogistics, supply chain, and fulfilment center.        You will also be responsible for managing the companys Last MileOperations, which includes the final delivery of goods to customers.       Requirements      Key Responsibilities:          Ensure 100% on-time vehicle placement for the First mile, mid-mile, and last mile logistics with track day-to-day operation.          Collaborating with dispatchersand route planners to ensure that delivery routes are   optimized for efficiency.         Managing deliverypersonnel, including drivers and loaders, to ensure that they are   meeting delivery timelinesand customer service expectations.         Overseeing the maintenance andrepair of delivery vehicles and ensuring that they   are compliant with safetyregulations.          Developing and implementing strategies for reducing delivery times andimproving   customer satisfaction.          Monitoring delivery performance metrics and identifying areas forimprovement.          Analyzing delivery data to identify trends and patterns and developingstrategies to   address any issues.          Managing relationships with third-party delivery providers, such as   Transporter/vendor and warehousing companies.          Ability to negotiate the cost from the vendor/transporter.          Onboard a large vendor base, who can provide Ad-hoc as well as Fixvehicles.          The person should be responsible for daily MIS reports.         What youwill do every day:         On-board Trucks ranging from 0.5 ton to 40 TonTrucks and shared warehouse space from 500-10000 sq. feet and company warehousespace from 10000-200000 sq. feet        On Board delivery partners for last mile servicefrom 2 -3-wheeler, EV trucks. Ensure that they are well-trained, process-drivenand customer-centric        On-boarding new customers for FTL, LTL Business forthe company through approaching new clients.        Ensure delivery of SLAs promised to the customer        Restore operations to normalcy when things break        Hire, coach and mentor a team ofSupervisors        Local Travel: The position is based at HomeLocation and requires you to be on the field for 26 days in a month Be willingto travel locally up to 250 km from your home location as required to overseetransportation operations and build relationships with transport, warehousepartners and vendors.        Language skills - Two or more languages -Kannada,Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, Marathi will be preferred and fluency in the locallanguage, with proficiency in English Hindi as a Mandatory.           Qualifications and Skills:        1) Prior experience in logistics, e-commerce, B2B, and D2C industries,with a focus on transportation and supply chain management.        2)    Familiarity with the local logistics landscape, including knowledge ofkey transport partners and their capabilities.        3) Proficiency in MS Excel and MS Word for data management,     analysis and reporting.        4) Excellent communication and negotiation skills to collaborateeffectively with internal and external stakeholders.        5)    High level of ownership commitment to maintaining dataconfidentiality, Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and abilityto multitask in a fast-paced environment.     6)    Flexibility and adaptability to handle changing priorities andoperational requirements.

column2: Perform mooring strength and fatigue analyses for passive and thruster-assisted spread and turret moored systems. Relevant knowledge in anchor types     Basic knowledge in geotechnical analysis, riser systems analyses. Model testing.     Riser analysis     Software (e.g. ANSYS AQWA, SeaSoft, SESAM, Orcaflex, Flexcom).     Strong communication, innovation, and teamwork skills.     Demonstrated leadership experience

column2: Lead a team of engineers and designers in carrying out electrical detailed engineering works and provide necessary technical information for procurement in compliance with tender specifications/data sheets and within budgeted man-hour and project schedules.     Review the ITB (Invitation To Bid) documents submitted in the proposals stage, issue inquiry requisitions, review techno-commercial vendor offers, prepare equipment, material and man-hour estimates.     Review contract requirements for project execution, organize the preparation of the Technical Document Register (TDR), identify requirements and scope of work; review specifications and Data Sheets, Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&ID s), Plot plans, General Arrangement (GA) drawings, Review Philosophies, Area Classification Drawings and other relevant documents. Establish contract review criteria, identify, and resolve discrepancies and divergences from original proposal through the instigation of technical queries to projects/client.     Verify scope of work, budgeted man hours, budgeted quantities, total of deliverables, format of delivery, time schedules and other specifications for execution of the work. Monitor man-hour costs and team schedules. Recommend cost effective measures to reduce the overall package costs.     Apportion work among engineering staff according to specialized training, supervise the preparation of equipment and cable layouts, lighting layouts, earthing and lightning protection layouts, cable schedules, bill of quantities, work estimations etc.     Organize the preparation of equipment and material specifications and data sheets, administer the development of detailed engineering calculations and drawings including the preparation of Load List/schedule Single Line Diagrams, Schematic Diagrams, Logic Diagrams, Cable Schedules and Cable Drum Schedules, Interconnection Schedules, Hazardous Area Classification, Equipment Lay-outs, Cable Routing and Lay-out Drawings, Cable Trench/Tray Lay-out Drawings, Lighting System Lay-out and Details, Earthing/Lighting System Lay-out and Details, Heat Tracing Lay-out and Details, Installation Standard Drawings, Relay Coordination Drawings and other required documents.     Supervise the preparation of technical inquiry requests (Inquiry Requisitions) to vendors, participate in the technical evaluation of vendor bid offers. Perform Technical Bid Evaluations (TBE), review vendor drawings and documents. Ensure vendor equipment specifications meet with client equipment specifications and are within budgeted costs.     Direct and provide guidance in the preparation and evaluation of plot plans, organize the issuance of engineering drawings and technical documents for Inter-Discipline Checks (IDC s) coordinate with other engineering discipline in the integration of technical data inputs.     Coordinate the preparation of Purchase Requisitions for the procurement of equipment and materials. Ensure materials are obtained within scheduled timeframes and budgeted costs.     Direct and monitor Material Take Off (MTO) activities, identify irregularities and shortfalls, take corrective action as required.     Interface and regularly meet with client and vendor representatives, conduct internal staff meetings, ensure the progress of project in accordance to schedule, allotted man hours and budgeted costs. Coordinate with projects and planning departments on schedule related issues. Update TDR progress reports using PETROCEPT software.     Participate in HAZOP meetings with the client and representatives of the other engineering disciplines.     Interact with Quality Assurance for quality issues, strictly ensure compliance with Company s ISO Quality procedures. Coordinate Internal and Client audit requests, facilitate audit procedures of engineering systems within the department.     Assumes the responsibilities of the Principal Engineer during absence.     Perform related duties as and when directed by Direct Supervisor.   Skills    Bachelor s Degree in electrical engineering with a minimum of 10 years of related petrochemical experience preferable from a background in working for consultancy organizations in the EPC.     Experience in eSCADA / PMS / IPMS / ENMCS.

column2: Job title - Hydrographic Surveyor (Dredging)Job location - MumbaiJob Responsibilities 1) Pre-Survey Planning:Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and objectives.Plan and organize survey activities, taking into consideration the specific needs of the dredging project.2) Data Collection:Use various survey equipment and technologies to collect data on bathymetry, sediment composition, and other relevant parameters.Conduct hydrographic surveys to measure water depth and map the underwater terrain.Utilize geophysical survey methods to assess soil conditions and identify potential obstacles.3) Instrument Operation:Operate specialized survey instruments such as single-beam and multi-beam echo sounders, side-scan sonar, and GPS equipment.Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data collected through proper calibration and maintenance of survey equipment.4) Data Analysis and Processing:Process, analyze, and interpret survey data using specialized software and tools.Generate accurate bathymetric charts, maps, and reports to support decision-making during dredging operations.5) Monitoring and Quality Control:Monitor ongoing dredging activities to ensure alignment with project specifications.Conduct regular quality control checks on survey data to identify and address any discrepancies or errors.6) Safety and Environmental Compliance: Ensure that survey activities comply with safety regulations and environmental protection standards.Identify and report any potential environmental impacts or safety hazards associated with dredging operations.7) Documentation:Maintain accurate and detailed records of survey data, methodologies, and results for future reference and reporting.Prepare comprehensive survey reports and contribute to project documentation.8) Continuous Improvement:Stay informed about advancements in surveying technologies and techniques.Recommend and implement improvements to survey methodologies to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of dredging surveys.

Please find given below the JD for Senior Marine Personnel Officer :Direct accountability to investigate and offer solutions to all personnel related matters and queries for personnel placed on vessels under their responsibility. Responsible for ensuring GDPR compliance across crewing operation management.Directly responsible for ensuring vessel compliance with respect to all employee personnel files, vessel files and database records necessary to accurately record employee, documentation, certification, training, and payroll in accordance with company policies and standards, whilst adhering to payroll deadlines.Direct accountability for the overall success of the crew change process including, liaison with the operations team to ensure crew changes are carried out successfully in line with Company policies and standards.Arranging travel to and from the vessel for all personnel under their responsibility including flights, accommodations, care hires, domestic travel etc. using most cost-effective means and adhering to company travel policies where applicable.Responsible to identify crew change requirements to various ports and arrange necessary visa and immigration requirements to comply crew change across entire global locations in timely manner. Responsible for communicating the forward planning on a weekly basis with the vessel management teams and all other stakeholders regarding crew changes and reliefs planning. To build relationships and collate feedback from seafarers.Responsible for ensuring vessel crewing matrix is distributed from Crewing database to relevant industry sites accurately and as per the set timelines and parameters.Reviewing seafarer appraisals with fleet group and identifying training or development needs.Coordinate Senior Officer appraisals, Office visit and pre-joining briefings. Process promotion and terminations in line with employer instructions.Coordinate of NMM and client specific company inductions (including delivery of Crewing elements)Liaison with the training team on scheduling of training courses for personnel under their responsibility.Daily maintenance of all employee personnel files, vessel files and database records necessary to accurately record employee locations, documentation, certification, training, and payroll in accordance with company policies and standards, whilst adhering to payroll deadlines.Have understanding of Marine Industry regulatory and certification legislation including but not limited to ISM Code, STCW and MLC 2006.Understand Employment structures (offshore employment) and applicable Collective Bargaining Agreements (CBA??).Participating in the on-call roster for out of hour?? coverage, offered by the personnel department.Arrange for seafarers to attend meetings, office assignments or other adhoc projects as required.Attend and input to meetings and management reporting as and when required, to meet strict deadlines.Other tasks and adhoc project related work as directed by the Line Manager.Other Administrative duties i.e. Absence maintenance, planning and rota management.You may be asked from time to time be asked to undertake other tasks within the NMMS function including Recruitment, Training, Payroll, Scheduling and Cadet Management that are considered to be relevant to your position.Pls contact Mayura - 8369709145 / mayura@busisol.net

column2: Role & responsibilities  1) Monitor engine, machinery, or equipment indicators and report abnormalities to appropriate shipboard staff. 2) Maintain electrical power, heating, ventilation, refrigeration, water, or sewerage systems. 3) Perform on-site operation, troubleshooting, preventive maintenance and service of oceanographic research equipment, Deep Sea Winch (DSW), Hydraulic Power Unit (HPU), Crane, Compressors, etc., 4) Conduct daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly maintenance as per schedule & update records. 5) Monitor acquisition & winch side operations of CTD, ROV, SAMS and Seismic equipment. 6) Maintain or repair engines, electric motors, pumps, winches, or other mechanical or electrical equipment or assist other crew members with maintenance or repair duties. 7) Perform equipment cleaning, assembling and sample collection during sediment sampling. 8) Coordinate with the client and OEM representative for upgradation, repair and calibration. 9) Supervise the activities of marine engine technicians engaged in the maintenance or repair of mechanical or electrical marine vessels and inspect their work to ensure that it is performed properly. 10) Timely completion and submission of reports; update relevant documents including technical service reports, daily reports, maintenance schedule, spares & consumables, etc. 11) Maintain cordial relationship & strictly adhere to rules & regulations onboard ratified by captain/scientists/seniors. 12) Regular follow-up on epidemic issues and take corrective actions. 13) Troubleshooting all the engine and mechanical equipment onboard vessels. 14) Undertake projects in Workshop, while being onshore. 15) In case of customer complaints, escalate to the management.  16) Prepare the handing over / taking over reports duly signed by reliever and handing over designatory. 17) Monthly submission of a performance report to meet with strategic objectives of the department & organization. Specific knowledge requirement: 1) Experience of practical troubleshooting on complex electrical/Mechanical equipment and systems 2) Experience in the installation, commissioning, repair and service of Marine Navigation Systems. 3) Ability to carry 20-25 Kg., comfortable working at height or in confined spaces. 4) Ability and willingness to work outdoors in all weathers. 5) It is advantageous to have Knowledge of Marine Navigation Systems including Radar, Gyrocompass, Autopilot, VDR & GMDSS systems. Specific Competency requirement: 1) Strong verbal communication and report writing skills 2) Critical Thinking 3) Customer Focus 4) Troubleshooting & Problem Solving 5) Team Commitment

column2: Accountable for financial statements and accounting   Business partnering with the management team   Management of cash flow with the Finance Operations team. In particular receivables and sub-agent funding.  Manage accounting processes with the team in the shared service team.   Compliance with globally standardized processes for financial reporting  Recognition of revenue in line with IFRS principles    Revenue / Cost matching in monthly management reporting  Adherence to Group Finance Policies as laid down in the Finance Manual  Assist in managing Customer accounts and maintaining up-to-date statements.  Preparation of analytical reports on Hub performance and track financial KPI         Key Accountabilities:        Financial Accounting Reporting (40%)   Ensure timely completion of reporting for the Managed Services  Support the preparation and review of all monthly Actuals reporting (PL and Balance Sheet) ensuring it is compliant with IFRS and Group accounting policies.  Ensure the completeness and accuracy of all management reporting in Hyperion    Ensure the accuracy of foreign currency accounting transactions in the system in accordance with the Group Finance Manual  Support the development of new system developments, to drive improved compliance and efficiency.  Have in-depth knowledge of the reporting systems (Hyperion Unit4Financial) to be able to advise end users on reporting requirements through the system.    Support the review of new IFRS requirements and/or regulatory issues and recommend how the business should prepare to meet them.  Support the rollout of a robust Financial Accounting and Reporting control environment that adheres to the Inchcape Group policies and embeds best practices across the business.  Ensure bank reconciliations are performed to reflect the correct position of the Global client contracts   Business partnering (20%)   Provide best-in-class technical accounting advice to the team through constant guidance and optimization of process  Support the identification and mitigation of accounting risks across the Group.  Support the business by educating and advising them on how to use the accounting systems.  Support ad hoc analysis as required by the Global teams, including Treasury, Tax, IT, Internal Audit, Legal and HR.   External Audit (20%)   Support the group audit process by providing the required documents  Support the team with guidance in preparing reconciliations and other work papers, including providing support to the Global Finance Consolidation team.   Finance team development (20%)   Be an active part of the senior finance team for Managed Services and support the Hub operations Develop the team of GL accountants into a professional, high-performing function.        Knowledge, Experience, and Skills:   Essential:   Excellent knowledge of IFRS and statutory accounting  Experience as a financial manager heading a team.  Experience in financial risk management and enforcing control environment.  Experience in working in a multi-national, multi-cultural organization.  Excellent communication skills and a good command of the English language (oral and written)  Experience in working on a group consolidation system.        Desirable: Good to have but not mandatory   Knowledge of the shipping industry  Knowledge of Hyperion Financial Management system  Knowledge of Unit4 Financial system  Experience in project management  Experience in managing a team           Education and Professional Qualifications:    Essential:   University degree in finance, accountancy, business   Qualified and Registered Chartered Accountant (ACA /ACCA / CPA (or equivalent)      Other Requirements:Essential:   Access to hi-speed reliable internet connectivity from home (during remote working)        Why Inchcape Shipping Services         We believe in building a diverse and high-performing workforce, that works together to provide our customers with the exceptional service they deserve. To reach the highest standards we depend on our people, their welfare, training, and expertise. We realize the value of our staff and know that your unique experiences, skills, and passions will help you to build a rich and rewarding career in our dynamic industry.          Our values are at the centre of everything we do and the successful candidate will be expected to demonstrate and fully adopt these:         Global Perspective - we connect the world and see the bigger picture.      The Power of People - we rely on the strength of local agent knowledge and relationships.      Progress - we adopt new thinking and push for positive change in our industry.          In return, we will offer you:          A diverse range of benefits, depending on your geographical location. Globally as a minimum, you will receive:           A retirement savings plan        Life assurance      Holiday starting at 22 days      Healthcare      Competitive salary      Employee Assistance Programme        Career development and progression opportunities      Values Award celebration events      Team building days           Plus, much more!          If you think that you have the right skills, knowledge, and attitude to join our team, then we invite you to apply by simply clicking at the top of this advert!          #ISSthebiggerpicture          Appointment to this role will be subject to satisfactory references and possession of a valid Right to Work documentation depending upon your geographical location.              #LI-MB1

column2: Core Tasks:  Manage Website Infrastructure    Set up a web host, configure access for users, establish news and mail servers, and seamlessly connect databases and other back-end components.    Responsible for familiarizing clients with the website and making sure it functions smoothly.    Monitor Performance    Evaluate website performance by checking metrics such as loading time and memory consumption.    Going beyond the technical aspects, they also assess user feedback, effectiveness, and traffic, explore marketing techniques such as newsletters and SEO to draw more users into the website.    Provide Technical Support    Websites require constant maintenance after setup. No matter how robust a site is, it?s never a one-time job, and you must be proactive when addressing user concerns and resolving bugs.    Additionally, upgrade and improve the fast-paced world of tech, so it?s up to you to integrate these advances.    Create and Update Web Pages    Work directly with code and often update webpages to add content or tweak the layout. For large-scale changes such as expanding the website, they create new web pages based on wireframes, which they may design themselves.    Evaluate Structure and Content    Contribute to the development of a website?s structure. Set basic standards for both graphics and content, check for quality before uploading components.    Skills and Qualifications    Must have strong technical expertise and problem-solving skills, with a working knowledge of both web development and system administration.    A drive for constant learning is helpful, since this role deals with various facets of the web, from infrastructure to content.    Web development ?   Must be proficient in web programming languages in order to update or create web pages.    At minimum, you should be able to convert designs into code through front-end development    Infrastructure expertise ?   Since the job revolves around maintaining websites, successful web admins are knowledgeable about security, hosting, network optimization, databases, and other infrastructure-related factors that affect a website?s performance    Testing ?   Test and debug website features, with the goal of making them error-free. Beyond programming tests, they also assess the website?s usability, design, content, and popularity    Dependability ?   Backups and disaster recovery plans    Tools of the Trade    Extremely proficient with the following tools:   Web programming languages (such as Javascript, Ruby, PHP, NodeJS)   Content management systems (such as WordPress, Drupal, Joomla)   Web analytic tools (such as Google Analytics, SEMRush, Open Web Analytics)   Web hosting services (such as Godaddy, AWS, HostGator, SiteGround, Bluehost)

column2: Project daily work: It is expected that the Senior Mechanical Surveyor / Mechanical Engineer will be involved in verification services for offshore platforms, subsea facilities, and onshore rigs (CAPEX / OPEX). This will include reviewing design and construction of the project as well as safety considerations. The work operation may include offshore construction monitoring, assessment of the project performance, site inspections and assessment of project management. The Senior Mechanical Surveyor / Mechanical Engineer will prepare and deliver technical reports, presentations and discuss methodologies and results with the internal Project Team and the Client. Construction submittals     Test documentation     QA/QC documentation     Inspection and Test Plans     Procedures     Conduct construction monitoring inspections of projects to verify compliance with:     Construction plans and specifications. Experience in Jacket, Topside fabrication, offshore installations, pre-commissioning, and commissioning.     Development, processing, and review of technical documentation. column2: JOB DESCRIPTION - Structural EngineerSenior structural Engineer will be responsible with engineering production processes / procedures and strive for continuous productivity and quality improvements/enhancements in such way that received objectives will be completed with no errors and within the allocated budget.SKILLS AND CAPABILITIES REQUIREMENTS:Capability of studying technical drawings & documents and to assess the material requirements.Review and establishment of requirements of materials on specific projects.Prepare material requirements based on accurate evaluations of customer specifications, terms and conditions, detailed or outline specifications, drawings, sketches, or following verbal instructions.Responsible for coordinating with production and projects department to help for the best TBT (Technical Bid Tabulation) related material delivery condition.Thorough knowledge in the selection of materials (material codes) based on its standard grades and specifications and as required by the major classification society or standards, such as DNV-GL, ABS, LR, Norsok, BS, EN, ISO, API.Technical review of all materials certificates and properties required for shipbuilding and offshore projects received from vendors.Prepare project deliverables list for structural projects, provide structural schedule analyses for detail drawings and production deliverables in line with master project schedule/milestones, indication of required man-power and keep track records on progress of deliverables. Supervise the work of Engineers, CAD designers and Subcontractors   to ensure quality standards and design criteria are met. Conduct building strategy meetings to assure that   safety and production efficiency are well defined and all established out   comings to be shown on engineering deliverables as detail assembly process   drawings. Experience in various hull structural design standards like   DIN/JIS/Norsok as well as a good understanding of ABS, DNV, API, AISC and   other related industry regulations and standards.Ensuring engineering work undertaken is accordance   with Departmental Work Instructions, Procedures and Standards.Ensure that the Safety, Quality & Environment requirements of   the yard are strictly followed.Attend, when requested, vessel inspections to define   the scope of work required for vessel modifications, repairs and conversions.Identification of changes of project specifications   or deliverables, variations to contractual scope, schedule impact due to   clients engineering delays and raising change orders within time limit   required by the project or department.Executing duties of project engineer according to qualification if   required.Knowledge of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus statistic and their applications.SOFTWARE KNOWLEDGE Exposed to usage of different design and detailing software like Aveva Bocad, , Cadmatic, Tekla Structures 2022, Navisworks Manage, AUTO CAD. EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONBachelor/Engineering degree in Naval Architecture/Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.10 - years relevant experience in shipyard, offshore / Oil & Gas industry in design and production engineering office.Have minimum 5 years experience with design engineering companies, where hands on exposure to a wide range of marine and offshore projects can be demonstrated. Minimum 5 years working experience in shipyard, major Production / Construction sites and heavy industrial segments.

column2: Job Position SummaryThe main responsibility of the Category Management Specialist (CMS) is to provide support to the category leader by delivering on category objectives. CMS will report to the category lead and assist with various category projects and initiatives. This position will occasionally be required to supervise junior team members indirectly and serve as a single point of contact for various supplier matters to the business and procurement colleagues.Key Roles and Responsibilities?? ?Participate in establishing the category strategies and support the category lead in delivering on the category strategies and plans. This will include various sub- categories under the main category.? E.g. For Machinery it would include Engines, TCs, Aux categories, BWTS, Scrubbers etc.?? ?Derive insights from historical spend data through internal purchasing and financial systems as well as assist the category lead in maintaining relevant vessel equipment data for forecasting purposes?? ?Analysis and interpretation of spend and supply data to measure performance, drive optimization, and continuous improvement on a global level?? ?Assist category lead in critical negotiations with key suppliers and execute agreed sourcing and negotiation projects?? ?Define vendor selection criteria in alignment with technical, and independently lead negotiations on projects with a large impact.?? ?To assist in performing supplier market analysis and organizing market intelligence for spend within Fleets operations and benchmarking the comparisons?? ?To assist in developing effective bidding, negotiation, and pricing strategies to provide the business with the best value in the marketplace for the dollars spent in a manner that meets the budgets, policies, ethical standards and audit requirements of the Group.?? ?To maintain and contribute to procurement policies and guidelines and ensure compliance at all times?? ?Develop a supplier management program with key category suppliers including metrics, performance goals and improvement initiatives?? ?Collaborate and cooperate with cross-functional category teams with the aim of driving cost reduction, improve quality and delivery performance and other applicable key performance areas?? ?Assist in indirect team management by occasionally coaching and supervising them, while ensuring team issues are resolved amicably?? ?Leading and participating in team initiatives that promote a healthy work environmentJob Experience, Functional Knowledge and Qualifications?? ?8+ years of work experience with at least 5yrs of procurement experience including negotiations and supplier relationships?? ?Good working knowledge of category management disciplines and processes?? ?Exposure to the marine industry or other heavy industry will be considered an advantage?? ?A self-driven team player, who understands the importance of stakeholder management, can build rapport at all levels even in challenging situations and can encourage and influence others without authority?? ?Have an entrepreneurial mindset with strong analytical and presentation skills?? ?Can handle risks and uncertainties and be flexible in adapting when priorities change. Must feel comfortable in challenging the status quo and are motivated to lead change?? ?Has a strong commercial mindset with a natural focus on achieving the most cost-effective solutions for the business?? ?Strong interpersonal skills, capable of developing and influencing internal and external relationships and holds command over spoken and written English?? ?Ability to understand and adapt technical requirements into procurement processes and related streamliningKindly share your resume to shabnam@olivegreenconsulting.com
column11: Any Graduate
column13: Category Management, Procurement, Category Strategies, Global Procurement, CMS, International Procurement

column2: JOB PURPOSEHandling all documentation, customer service and operations for Imports and Exports for TLSS Inc. based in USA through back office in Mumbai.  Currently more focused on documentation, customer service and operations for Domestic Trucking in USA. KEY RESPONSIBILITIESImports Custom Service & Documentation:        Maintain ETA-wise track of shipments arriving into US. Ensure jobs have been created 7-10 days prior ETA. If not, to inform the documentation person to do the job creation. In case of urgency, to ensure the data is entered by Self.  Arrival notice is sent to customer along with the applicable charges.To get Arrival notice from line (Carrier).        Providing Delivery order to customer as per request.        Original master bill of lading to be surrendered to line if needed.        Request customer/consignee/broker to present Original house bill of lading.        Payment follow-up from customer/consignee/broker, if any charges are pending.        Keep in close contact with the customer/consignee/broker and get their payment and OHBL. Also check for other opportunities of work from them.        Once payment and OHBL is received from customer, to inform the Accounts team to send liner payment.        Provide invoices to customer regarding any additional amounts received from line.        Billing into the system all charges received from line.        Collecting payment proof from customer of all local collect charges.        Providing Last free day & Pick-up number to customer/consignee/broker once the same is received from the Line/Carrier.        Invoice the demurrage/detention charges to customer, for late pick up.        Providing empty return depot to customer as mentioned by line.        If empty container not returned within free time, pls keep customer informed for immediate return of empty. column2: ?    You will be working out of our Mumbai office reporting to the Head of Infrastructure Operations. You will be managing IT security globally in daily collaboration with colleagues from Group IT and other related departments in India, Denmark, Singapore, and the Philippines.   Your tasks will include:   Technical implementation of defined cyber security initiatives.   Optimizing the tools already implemented for enhancing our information security (e.g. SIEM, AD audit tools, AD security, PKI infrastructure, Antivirus, vulnerability monitoring tool, etc.).   Work on building our security setup in Azure together with our cloud infrastructure manager.  Analyzing and suggesting solutions to new security issues and implementation of cutting-edge security tools for TORM.  Working alongside colleagues globally and help them mitigate information security risks by enhancing our ability to predict, prevent and handle security incidents.   Communication with internal stakeholders and external vendors regarding security initiatives.  Profile    Professionally, you have 5-7 years of operational experience as a security consultant, system administrator or similar.    We expect you to have practical experience with some of the following areas:   Hardening of network infrastructure   Network communication and technology   Vulnerability management incl. SIEM tools    Access and privilege management   PKI architecture   PowerShell scripting as we try to automate as much as possible also on security.    To succeed as a security consultant, you should have:    Attention to detail as well as top-notch technical skills.   Great communication and interpersonal skills.   An analytical mindset to do analysis and investigations.   You are a team player with a positive mindset, and you are fluent in English both verbally and in writing.     We offer    As an employee in TORM, you will be part of a leading, world-class shipping company. Our corporate culture is characterized by well-defined values and an informal, but performance-oriented working environment.   We offer a competitive salary which will reflect your experience and qualifications, and an attractive benefits package including bonus and pension.   We are an international team, built on common values embracing innovation, diversity, mutual respect, passion to make a positive difference, accountability, commitment to excellence, and teamwork. We believe in the importance of personal and professional development.   Working at TORM can be challenging, but it is also rewarding and inspiring as we work continually on securing a safe, pleasant, and ergonomic work environment. Our ambition is for you to find a good balance between your work and your private life. Whatever your function at TORM will be, your contribution will make a difference.

column2: Job Description Job Title: Head of Engineering Job Location: MumbaiJob Type: Full Time Job Summary: We are in search of a Head of Engineering to join our client team.Lead the team to develop business strategies, policies, and procedures to manage Engineering and Equipment performance to achieve the optimal use of resources and the optimal level of equipment/infrastructure availability and reliability. Conduct technology scanning that could enhance the business, monitor the use and implementation of new and existing technologies across the organization. Job Responsibilities: a) To ensure the budget are appropriate drawn and meets the corporate target by: ??Implementing Corporate policies ??Aligning department workplan with BU targets defined ??Identifying new technologies/systems which can be applied creating business cases for costs reduction ??Identifying and implementing measures to reduce inefficiencies on the teams performance, engineering processes, equipment power and fuel consumption ??Working closely with Operations department in analysing Equipment costs performance for establish utilization strategies. KPI ??Equipment cost per box ??Inventory/Stock amount ??Average time for stock replacement ??P&F cost per box ??Staff costs/ Overtime costs b) To ensure that the equipment and the infrastructure availability and reliability meets the corporate target by: ??Analysing statistics and trends of equipment performance ??Analysing the root cause of equipment breakdown and identifying/implementing new development opportunities ??Ensuring the appropriate follow up actions are undertaken by the respective/relevant sections (QC/RTG & Mobile Equipment) ??Overseeing continuous improvements on staff productivity/flexibility, assessing their utilisation ??Overseeing/ensuring the equipment availability, keeping the maintenance backlogs under the targets ??Overseeing/analysing whether the equipment useful life can be stretched ??Overseeing/ensuring the Engineering Maintenance Plans are followed/implemented according to PSA Group standards. KPI ??MBBF??MTTR??MTBF ??Equipment availability??Team workload rate??Maintenance Backlogs ??Compliance c) To create and managelong-termm partnership with key suppliers by: ??Identifying long term partners ??Cultivating good relationships with key personnel of suppliers ??Working with Procurement department to get frame agreements/opportunities with key suppliers KPI ??Number of frame agreements ??Number of disputes between suppliers??Reduction of transit time for stock purchases d) To create a conductive and safe work environment to increase staff productivity and asset utilization by: ??Support the implementation and compliance of safety laws and regulations and improve safety culture. ??Ensure occupational health and safety without any limit and comply with the published and implemented procedures and regulations and all other laws, regulations, and national and statutory legislation of the working life KPI ??LTIF??No. and cost of incidents ??100% Compliance with Machinery Directive??100% Compliance with Minimum Safety Equipment Specifications e) To ensure the development of Staff by: ??Ensuring fairness and consistency of annual appraisal in accordance with their work performance. ??Overseeing the implementation of individual training roadmaps and appropriate on-job-training (OJT) program. ??Approving / recommending / implementing appropriate disciplinary actions. ??Aligning staff to departmental work plans through regular dialogue / communication sessions. ??Support the growth of an efficient organisational structure to manage all resources (people, equipment, assets, systems) in an optimal way to optimise operational efficiency and service levels at minimal cost. ??Provide direction to the technical team and communicate a clear understanding of job responsibilities, objectives, deadlines and performance expectations. KPI ??Morale of staff (retention / discipline).??Readiness of Staff for succession / job rotation. Job Requirements: 1.Professional/ Educational - Degree in Electrical / Mechanical / Mechatronics Engineering ??At least 15-18 years of experience and has experience managing a team. 2 .Technical experienced in terminal equipment maintenance and automation. ??Able to do engineering design, testing, commissioning and related maintenance work. ??Appreciation of financial knowledge. ??Understanding of basiccontainer/equipmentt handling characteristics. ??Ability to see the broad picture, beyond details of daily operations, withthe  aid of process mapping skills 3. Business Understand the business environment ??Understand customer's key operating philosophy / competitive strength ??Alignment with Operations for smooth functioning. ??Understanding of budgeting and cost management Salary & Perks: ??Salary no bar for the right candidate. ??Competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications. ??Opportunity for career growth and advancement. If you're ready to take your career to new heights, don't miss this opportunity! Apply now by sharing your latest resume along with Current CTC, Expected CTC, and notice period details to support@smashrglobal.com with the subject line "[Position Applied for] Application - [Your Name]". Feel free to share this job with your network if you know someone who would excel in this role. Join the dynamic team and be part of our client's growth story. We can't wait to hear from you! column2: Joining the WOP team, you will be at the forefront of our operational relationships with internal stakeholders and external customers, ensuring the seamless delivery of core datasets that power our current and future WOP initiatives.      As a Senior Manager, you will be instrumental in meeting all KPIs for data collection, verification, validation, and delivering APIs to our valued customers.      Your domain expertise will be essential in developing new products and gathering valuable feedback from both internal and external clients, providing valuable user stories for future solution development.                What you ll do:            Lead and mentor a talented team of 10+ members, fostering their growth and development.        Cultivate strategic partnerships with key business stakeholders, shaping product data collection, structure, and content.      Uphold data governance to ensure the utmost quality and conformity across our products and services for external customers.      Engage in frequent, meaningful dialogues with customers to ensure we continuously exceed their expectations and stay attuned to their requirements.      Collaborate with the Inchcape Network to maintain the accuracy and excellence of data pertaining to PTB, Line up data, and more.      Work closely with Management and the Data team to enhance product specifications and deliver exceptional data samples to external clients, perfectly aligned with their needs.        Champion the development of a centralized framework for data services, empowering the consumption of our data sets across the organization.      Provide consistent and compelling data stories that support our roadmap and pipeline of projects, ensuring smooth delivery to the team.      Skilfully manage various data work streams executed within the team, employing your expertise to provide "thought leadership" throughout the organization.      Curate and manage artifacts that underpin new and existing processes, definitions, and outcomes, ensuring efficiency and effectiveness.      Take charge of sprint delivery ceremonies and provide insightful progress updates to senior managers.            Who you are:            You possess extensive experience in the Maritime Domain, coupled with hands-on knowledge of Port terminals Berth, vessel operations, and Port Operations.      Your understanding of Marine Assurance and strong networks within the maritime sector set you apart as a true expert.        You recognize the critical role of information in supporting maritime commercial and operational decision-making and risk mitigation.      Knowledge of the digital transformation in the Shipping industry positions you as a forward-thinking leader.      You have a proven ability to inspire, mentor, and motivate teams, fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.      Your comprehensive knowledge of major software packages and project management skills are second to none.      With your track record in successfully managing data projects and delivering large-scale IT systems, youre well-equipped to tackle any challenge.        Adaptable and skilled in managing projects through change, you excel in reporting progress and ensuring outcomes align with objectives.      Experience in an SME environment has honed your ability to navigate conflicting priorities with ease.      Your experience in working with geographically dispersed teams and managing departmental standards positions you as a well-rounded leader, capable of achieving exceptional results.
